agents

Class Actor<StateT extends agents.State>

  • java.lang.Object
    • agents.Actor<StateT>

  • public abstract class Actor<StateT extends agents.State>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  Actor.ProtocolRunner
      This class performs a run of the specified protocol.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> addressMap
      The list of addresses for roles that is fixed for all runs of the protocol.

      The communications protocol implementation to be used.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Actor.ProtocolRunner> ongoingRuns
      The map of run IDs to the objects performing the run.
      protected java.util.Set<java.lang.Thread> ongoingThreads
      The set of running threads (one ID, one thread).
      protected protocol.Script<StateT> script
      The script to be executed by the actor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        Actor(protocol.Script<StateT> script,
      communications.AbstractProtocol commProtocol)
        Starts an Actor with a given script and a communication protocol implementation.
        Parameters:
        script - the script to be followed by the actor.
        commProtocol - the object supplying the communication services.

    • Method Detail

      • ongoingRunFilter

        protected boolean ongoingRunFilter(communications.AbstractMessage inMessage)
        The filter that selects all messages pertaining to an active runs. This method is used as a Predicate to decide whether the associated message receive event will be executed or not.
        Parameters:
        inMessage - the received message to be tested.
        Returns:
        true in case the message pertains to an active run.
        See Also:
        ongoingRunMRE

      • ongoingRunMRE

        protected void ongoingRunMRE(communications.AbstractMessage inMessage)
        The message receive even that processes the messages pertaining to active runs of the protocol. This method basically puts the received message to the BlockingQueue of the run's thread (with due checks made).
        Parameters:
        inMessage - the received message.
        See Also:
        ongoingRunFilter

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.lang.String role,
                       java.lang.String address)
        Sets the address of a role in the addressMap. This address is the one (and the only one) that will be used by all protocol runs. The idea here is to either restrict the addresses that can perform a certain role or to set addresses that have to be known beforehand (e.g. a server address).
        Parameters:
        role - the role whose address is being set
        address - the address to be set for the role

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress(java.lang.String role)
        Gets the address for the given role in the addressMap.
        Parameters:
        role - the role for which the address is to be given.
        Returns:
        the address set for the role or null, in case none is set.
